definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
plants sprouting
receptacle
to appear/to arise/to emerge/to show up
to raise (an issue)/to propose/to put forward/to suggest/to post (on a website)/to withdraw (cash)
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to come out/to appear/to arise
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to come out/to appear/to arise
to indicate/to point out
an exit/CL:個|个[ge4]/to speak/to export/(of a ship) to leave port
to officially launch (a policy, program etc)/to appear on stage/to appear publicly/(of a bar girl) to leave with a client
to attend/to participate/present
prominent/outstanding/to give prominence to/to protrude/to project
to act (in a play)/to perform/to put on (a performance)/performance/concert/show/CL:場|场[chang3],次[ci4]
to issue (an order, decree etc)/to send out/to dispatch/to produce (a sound)/to let out (a laugh)
remarkable/outstanding
to be born

sentences.english: Blush can be poured through a hidden semi-transparent cover, very fitting skin.
sentences.chinese: 腮红可透过隐藏的半透明罩倒出，极度贴合肌肤。

sentences.english: I saw a plant growing out of a crevice in the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我看到墙缝里长出一棵草来。

sentences.english: It also reflects the pantheistic experimentation of the period immediately following the Civil War.
sentences.chinese: 同时也反映出了泛神论时期紧跟的内战时期状态。

sentences.english: We must first calculate the horse-power needed to propel the ship.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须首先计算出驱动这艘船需要多大马力。

sentences.english: The thief walked out of the gallery with the picture underneath his painter's smock.
sentences.chinese: 他把画藏在了漆工的工作服下然后把它带出了画廊。

sentences.english: Judge Orie had the curtains drawn while Mladic was taken out of court.
sentences.chinese: 当姆拉迪奇被带出法庭时，法官奥列将帘子拉下。

sentences.english: The conjurer waved his magic wand and pulled a rabbit out of the hat.
sentences.chinese: 魔术师挥舞魔杖，从帽子里拉出一只兔子。

sentences.english: The hecklers were conducted away from the hall at the request of the Chairman.
sentences.chinese: 主席要求把捣蛋分子强行赶出大厅。

sentences.english: My master went back to his friends and we took the boat out to sea.
sentences.chinese: 主人回到他的朋友们那儿去了，我们坐船出了海。

sentences.english: As the police moved in, the hostages were running out, he said.
sentences.chinese: 随着警方进入该区域，人质也都四散跑出。

sentences.english: Reasons for higher success rates among women are difficult to isolate.
sentences.chinese: 女人高成功率的原因很难去单独分析出。

sentences.english: Embracing warm blood, I sing of youth without regret. Look upon the horizon and know not when my ally would return.
sentences.chinese: 满腔热血唱出青春无悔，望穿天涯不知战友何时回。

sentences.english: No matter how carefully I plan my time, the plan always goes wrong.
sentences.chinese: 不论怎么仔细安排时间，我的计划总是出问题。

sentences.english: Supported user-defined unread notification of automatical protection.
sentences.chinese: 支持用户自定义的新未读消息弹出提示。

sentences.english: You couldn't drag that information out of me.
sentences.chinese: 你休想从我这儿套出消息。

sentences.english: Bentham sums up two principles that are applicable to penalty.
sentences.chinese: 边沁归纳出了刑罚适用的两个基本原则。
